article: Joan's job is to use American Sign Language(ASL)to enable teachers to communicate with EngLish-speaking deaf students. According to Joan,learning ASL was not that _ ,but learning to be an excellent interpreter could take a lifetime.  Three years after being admitted to Pierce College,Joan _ as a Certified ASL Interpreter.Plenty of job _ were waiting for her.She likes the college environment, _ she applied for a job at Newton Community College with 28,000 students in it.There are 22 students who were _ of hearing at NCC.Joan has _ with most of them.  They are very _ with her.Often they invite her to talk _ a cup of coffee after class.Sometimes the women talk about _ things,especially about how hard it is to find"Mr.Right."Joan _ with them,saying she herself has given up on finding him.  Joan is one of the four interpreters in the college.She accompanies a deaf student to _ .The student sits in the front row.Joan usally sits near to the teacher, facing the student.She _ as the teacher talks. If the class is longer than 90 minutes,there are two interpreters per student.They take _ ;one interpreter will sign for 20 minutes,and then the other will.  Joan will go _ to school soon.She wants to become a Certified French Sign Language Interpreter.Her non taught Joan that American men are _ .She frequently told Joan that onlv a(n) _ man knows how to make a woman feel like a woman.Joan _ her mom.and takes her _ to heart.Her plan is to leave California,to move to Paris,find a romantic French boy-friend,and live happily ever after.
